description: Triangle giving a(n,k) = number of (n,k) labeled Greg trees (n >= 2, 0<=k<=n-2).
comments: An (n,k) Greg tree can be described as a tree with n black nodes and k white nodes where only the black nodes are labeled and the white nodes are of degree at least 3.Row sums give A005263.
references: C. Flight, How many stemmata?, Manuscripta, 34 (1990), 122-128.
links: M. Josuat-Vergès, Derivatives of the tree function, arXiv preprint arXiv:1310.7531, 2013
Index entries for sequences related to trees
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
extensions: More terms from Larry Reeves (larryr(AT)acm.org), Apr 07 2000
